title: American_Top_40_1985_April_27th
description:
"We're counting down the hits, the 40 biggest hits from the official Billboard charts. I'm Casey Kasem, this is American Top 40, and the countdown continues on our way to the number one song in the USA."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

The Canadian who holds the record for the biggest selling album in Canada has two songs from that album in this countdown.

A listener wants to know what woman has had the most hits on the pop chart, the soul chart, and the country chart. Casey says the Queen of Soul has had the most hits on the soul chart with 66 songs. Topping the pop chart with 69 hits is a woman who was once in a group, then went solo, and also has plenty of duets to her Supreme credit. And the Queen of the country chart (whom we will always love) with 70 hits is from Locust Ridge, Tennessee.

Casey tells whatever became of David Cassidy.

Tears For Fears has their first top 40 hit, "Everybody Wants To Rule The World" at number 18, and so does Simple Minds at number 5 with "Don't You (Forget About Me)."

Casey answers the question, "What recording artist has hit the top 40 singing duets with the most partners?" This legend sang duets with four different female partners.

"We Are The World" is at number one with solos by Lionel Richie, Stevie Wonder, Paul Simon, Kenny Rogers, James Ingram, Tina Turner, Billy Joel, Michael Jackson, Diana Ross, Dionne Warwick, Willie Nelson, Al Jarreau, Bruce Springsteen, Kenny Loggins, Steve Perry, Daryl Hall, Huey Lewis, Cyndi Lauper, Kim Carnes, Bob Dylan, and Ray Charles (*whew*).
